name: 15% Vitamin C and EGF Brightening Serum
about: What it is:u00a0 A highly stable vitamin C serum and plant-derived EGF that delivers a potent dose of actives to help brighten dull, stressed-out skin...Skin Type:u00a0Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns:u00a0Dark Spots, Dullness, and Uneven Texture..Formulation:u00a0Lightweight Serum..Highlighted Ingredients:.- 15% Ascorbyl Glucoside (Vitamin C): Brightening antioxidant Vitamin C helps improve hyperpigmentation..- 1% Epitensiveu2122: Plant-derived peptide helps to visibly regenerate the skin's appearance...Ingredient Callouts:u00a0This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and is reef safe...What Else You Need to Know:u00a0 Supercharged skin-brightening. Powered by 15% antioxidant vitamin C and plant-based peptide EGF to deliver a double dose of brightening and rejuvenation with every use. This powerful yet gentle serum leaves skin visibly brighter and firmer-looking...CLEAN at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing on effectiveness.
ingredients: 15% Ascorbyl Glucoside (Vitamin C): Brightening antioxidant Vitamin C helps improve hyperpigmentation. .1% Epitensiveu2122: Plant-derived peptide helps to visibly regenerate the skin's appearance....Water, Ascorbyl Glucoside, Sodium Hydroxide, PEG-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Phenoxyethanol, Benzyl Alcohol, Butylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Metabisulfite, Dehydroacetic Acid, Phytic Acid, Oligopeptide-1...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Use AM and PM..-Apply a pea-sized amount to face and neck.-Follow with your preferred moisturizer.-Always finish with SPF for your AM routine...INKEY Tip: Use in your AM routine to help you get the most out of the its antioxidant properties. ...Avoid using Vitamin C in the same routine as Retinol, Alpha Hydroxy Acid products (Glycolic Acid, Lactic Acid, AHA, Mandelic Acid or Apple Cider Vinegar) or BHAs (Beta Hydroxy Acid or C-50 Blemish Treatment). Use Vitamin C in the morning and Retinol OR AHAs/BHAs/PHAs in the evening.

reviews.review_text: The Inky List Vitamin C & EGF Brightening Serum is a fantastic addition to any skincare routine. reviews.review_text: I would love to give this 5 stars, since Iu2019ve been using it for years, and when it does work it works well for my HP, acne, redness, etc. however itu2019s really hit or miss. Half of all the bottles Iu2019ve bought have been already oxidized and sticky on the first use. When I get a good bottle the serum is clear and has a slight almost unnoticeable sweet smell and glides in and absorbs so smoothly. However the bottle I JUST bought and opened (as well as half of my previous bottles) are orange, sticky, smell weird, and pill under my other products. I live in a rural area without a Sephora so I donu2019t have the option of going to the store to return it and I donu2019t have the money to ship it back and wait for a refund so Iu2019m stuck going without until I can afford to just buy another.   Great product but terrible execution. I wish it was better!

reviews.review_text: Vitamin C is a hard one to review because, for me, it's largely preventative. Much like eating enough fiber, vitamin c is something I don't notice until I stop using it. I don't have much discoloration or spots to fade. When I do get the occasional hormonal acne, I notice this serum helps fade the mark it usually leave behind. It's caused no irritation and my skin can be sensitive. The smell is, not bad but not great. Luckily is fades fast. It can feel a wee bit tacky and I feel like when it dries it's a little sticky, but not noticeable after sunscreen. For the price, I'll definitely repurchase. Again, I see this more as a preventative product so as long as I don't see any new lines, spots, or dullness to my 34 year old skin, I'm figuring it's working.

reviews.review_title: Not the effective form of Vit C
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is not pure vitamin C (ascorbic acid), this is ascorbyl glucoside, meaning it is not nearly as effective as true vitamin C and the studies to show any actual benefits for the skin of any form of vit C other than L-ascorbic are very weak.  Iu2019ve used this a bit in the past before having knowledge on skincare ingredients, so I can say that the packaging is poor, the pump is difficult to use and the product will always drip down the bottle even though Iu2019m very careful with it.  While it probably wonu2019t do any harm to your skin because itu2019s a gentle product, if you want a vitamin C thatu2019ll actually provide decent results, donu2019t get this one despite it being cheap. Get a vitamin C in its proper form. It doesnu2019t have to be expensive, there are plenty at the drugstore and the likes. Learn to read ingredient lists I promise you itu2019ll save you money and time!
